basic.description: This course provides the student with a foundation in the subdisciplines of bacteriology, virology, parasitology, and immunology. The course is designed to examine common infectious diseases through a body-systems approach. Laboratory and tutorial sessions emphasize diagnostic microbiology.
basic.subject: MICR
basic.title: Microbiology for Nursing Students

extra.enrollment_requirement:
PREREQUISITE    BCHM 102/3.0.
ONE-WAY EXCLUSION    May not be taken with or after: MICR 125/3.0; MICR at the 200-level or above.
